website_summaries.verdict: Choose it if you need a wrench for mini tasks, small nuts and bolts, and tight spaces – this sturdy little hand tool can go where others can't; otherwise, it's not very practical.
pros: Small yet strong, has similar durability and functions as larger adjustable models in a handy 4-inch size
Has etched measurements in inches and metric
cons: Only suited for small applications, but this is also a plus for some users
Jaw mechanism has been reported to get a bit loose over time

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but not the best quality.  Sloppy & loose tolerances
customer_reviews.text: This is not a very good crescent-style wrench. The fit and finish is such that the lower jaw is wobbly and will never quite hold a precise adjustment. It's just made to sloppy tolerances, apparently. When I compare it to my more expensive, name-brand adjustable wrenches, the difference is obvious. More expensive wrenches will have a solid, smooth movement of the adjustable parts, resulting in tight, consistent jaw openings. That isn't how this wrench works, unfortunately. That isn't to say this is not a useful tool. I couldn't find a 4" adjustable wrench anywhere else for anywhere close to the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Dobbs

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but NOT "cheap"
customer_reviews.text: I've come to trust Tekton in recent years for good quality tools at low prices. I don't always want to invest big bucks in a tool I might only use a few times, but I really hate spending money on a tool that is so poorly made that it doesn't work well! Tekton has become my goto brand in those cases. This crescent wrench is a great example. The spiral adjustment mechanism turns easily but is not loose or sloppy. The tool is nicely finished with accurate inch and metric opening size rulers etched on the jaw. It worked great for my plumbing task, unlike the more expensive noname wrench I first bought for the job.
customer_reviews.author: Mondoman

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality. Looks good (nice finish, parts fit well, adjuster works smoothly). Feels good (lots of heft, feels solid). Works good. This is the 15in version. I also purchased a 12in Crescent brand wrench at the same time. The Tekton looks and feels better. I bought the 12in for the name, and the 15in for the price, expecting that the 15in wouldn't get as much use as the 12. I guess I should have bought two Tektons instead, I keep reaching for the Tekton 15in even when the 12in is big enough.
customer_reviews.author: T.M.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Adjustable portion of head very loose, when closed will move off to one side and misalign with fixed part of head. Looks like quality, but quality control let this glitch out the door. Instead of replacement, my request was refund. At 70 i have more money than time so will buy what i can touch/see first. Amazon refunded my money. The time spent trying to pick a quality product is forever lost.
customer_reviews.author: mrgizmow

customer_reviews.title: Junk.
customer_reviews.text: I'd give it a 0 if possible. Feel apart after 6 months barely even used it. The pin that holds in the adjustment knob fell out and I'd stick it back in to adjust but after I used it it'll slip back our again! That's what I get for being cheap. Stick to channeloc's since this was my second one I thought I'd give it a chance but as you can see it was 2 losses for me. Finally lost the pins and surrendered with this review. Don't like leaving bad reviews but 5 star rating should be quality not junk. Reviews are so misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Mardo N

customer_reviews.title: Good quality considering the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these (8 inch) for assembling/disassembling components of an airless paint sprayer. We're not talking spacecraft-level tolerances here so these wrenches work fine for that purpose. I'm not a diesel mechanic either so I'm not using pipe extensions to force stuck bolts with these, which I doubt would last long if treated that way. But for light/medium duty everyday use these are fine, as long as you realize that's what they're intended for.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Solid Adjustable Wrench for GF’s Car
customer_reviews.text: A good condition and very inexpensive adjustable wrench to add to the toolbox! I actually bought this to keep in my girlfriend’s car (in lieu of a whole socket set to save money) and it’s perfect for what we need. Some reviewers have mentioned that the jaws are loose, and I suppose a little, if you’re shaking it around a lot. But when used for its intended purpose I find the locking mechanism works great. We just switched out her car battery with this tool and nothing else!
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Howard

customer_reviews.title: This is Seriously the best budget adjustable wrench on the market Hands-Down
customer_reviews.text: This is Seriously the best budget adjustable wrench on the market Hands-Down. I use this wrench everyday as a mechanic that works on suspension components that are stuck with years of rust i have put pipes and cheater bars on this wrench all the time and hit it with my 2.5lb sledgehammer and it has always gotten the job done. I've seen Snap-On and other name brands round fasteners and snap off with the kind of abuse only to lend them this wrench and see them succeed. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a good quality crescent wrench. 10/10 I had to buy another one because it was just that tough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hilariously tiny!
customer_reviews.text: In retrospect I don’t know what I expect for a 4 inch wrench but opening the box was a big laugh. I imagine sit would be a bit bulkier, it looks as if it was an ordinary wrench that was scaled down in Adobe photoshop. Don’t take this the wrong way, the wrench works, the handle could be a inch longer but as is, it gets the job done. Would buy again, but only for small craft jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Tekton is great!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something like this on my keychain because life throws you situations in need of one of these sometimes! So this guy does the trick. Durability ehh is okay for what you gotta do I guess. The Jaws seem like they could come loose at some point but, hey it's not like I spent a million dollars on it!
customer_reviews.author: Jaywil

customer_reviews.title: One of my most used tools in the shop right behind the 4lbs engineer hammer
customer_reviews.text: This is incredibly useful when working on stupid GM cars that have both metric and SAE bolts scattered throughout. It makes it really easy to find the right size socket the first time or for less annoying bolts you can just use this. This is actually 3 tools in 1 because it's got enough gravity in it to make a decent hammer, it's a very solid wrench, and it has metric and SAE measurements for finding the right socket.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Pocket sized wrench
customer_reviews.text: Tiny 4" wrench that fits in your pocket. A great every day carry. It has a minor amount of play in the adjustment wheel, but if you're buying Tekton you probably want mid range quality. The metal has not rusted yet. The jaws haven't rounded off. Overall a good purchase. Buy spares because it's easy to lose.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Nice wrench, too thin.
customer_reviews.text: I like this wrench I bought it for work so I wouldn't mess up my nice crescent wrench, but the handle is thinner than the handle on my crescent wrench so if I'm really tightening or loosening something tight it can be a little painful where my crescent wrench is wider and far more comfortable in my hand. Otherwise it's a decent wrench for the money..
customer_reviews.author: ODB

customer_reviews.title: Well Made Wrench
customer_reviews.text: The Tekton is a great wrench that has worked out well. When you start getting up in size like this 15 inch wrench, I need a tool that isn't going to fail on me especially when you start putting a lot of force on it. Fit and finish are nice and the jaws operate smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Cincinnatus

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to help me change my tie rods ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help me change my tie rods. I Used this to hold one side while twisting the nut off with a bigger size wrench. Seemed to do the job for me. I own many Tekton products and haven't regretted purchasing one yet. They back up their product and are way less expensive than other brand names. The only flaw I saw was the handle curved a bit on the flat side, hence the 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: icorona1015

customer_reviews.title: sometimes small is better
customer_reviews.text: I have had at least one of these adjustable wrenches for many years and I had dropped it outside this summer and it got all rusted. These are a great tool when you are dealing with either SAE or metric and a larger wrench does not fit the space allowed. I keep on in my pocket just incase
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Could’ve been good may be good might try again
customer_reviews.text: Could’ve been a great product but spindle the Titans jaw did not hold up after a few uses they goodness it was bought on Amazon easy return I’m sure this is a case by case basis may try to purchase another set
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: lose jaw
customer_reviews.text: i love Tekton tools but this adj. wrench is only 3.5/5 stars. the lower jaw is a little loose and wobbly and has a lot of play in it still works good but I wasn't expecting the bottom to be like that.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Straw

customer_reviews.title: Well built. Great price
customer_reviews.text: One star off for being made in China, but let’s be honest it’s hard to find made in USA tools anywhere anymore. This is a very sturdy well built wrench with very little slop and the price was great. This is a lot better than most of the Chinese junk out there.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Dave

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Trash!!! UGH!!!😡
customer_reviews.text: Absolute Trash!! I only purchased this to remove a shower head. This trashy wrench would not grip it at all. Waste of money and time. I have to go to the big orange box store to make sure the next wrench purchase is heavy duty. UGH!!!
customer_reviews.author: Teri Jones

customer_reviews.title: Eh, can use but wouldn’t get again
customer_reviews.text: It does it’s job, but it’s really annoying how the adjuster keeps unscrewing as you’re using it. I have to keep re-tightening and holding the adjuster/threader as I’m using it to try to keep it from getting loose.
customer_reviews.author: v

customer_reviews.title: Cheap made in China
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 8 inch wrench. Was so disappointed. There is excessive free play both up and down and sideways and adjusting barrel also has lots of play. Tekton needs to make them in USA or least in Taiwan. Have better workmanship in the factory. Socket sets are great, wrench really bad like dime store wrenches.
customer_reviews.author: owner

customer_reviews.title: Great value and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I have a small wrench, but needed one that was larger. This one is great. I love the markings in inches and in mm on the opposite side. It's sturdy and feels like it will last a very long time!
customer_reviews.author: Michael G

customer_reviews.title: High quality tiny wrench
customer_reviews.text: This thing is very small and fits in very tight spaces. It looks like it belongs to a toy tool set but it's a high quality tool. I have used this wrench in spots that would otherwise be impossible to reach. I just used it to assemble a steel storage shelving unit that without this tiny wrench it would not be possible to tighten the nuts with any other tool.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Owens

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made, rough finish, bad performance
customer_reviews.text: The knurl catches in three spots, requiring a great amount of force to drive the claw. The finish feels bad in the hand, and the overall look and feel is of a cheaply made tool. Returning for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Sloppy
customer_reviews.text: Gearing is sloppy so it works but not very well. Lots of fiddling with it. Seriously - it's a hunk of junk. Not worth the time, effort or money to return. It does look pretty but too big for a key chain.
customer_reviews.author: Paul F. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: A handy little adjustable wrench
customer_reviews.text: This is a very handy adjustable wrench. It is about as big as your index finger. The jaw works smoothly without grabbing and catching. I can adjust this using my arthritic thumb with no problems. You can tighten up to a Â1⁄2" or 13mm nut. There is not a lot of handle on this so do not expect to torque the nut much. I find this very handy for those places where a full sized wrench or adjustable wrench will not easily fit.
customer_reviews.author: DocHolliday

customer_reviews.title: Great size if you want to save weight and don't need a lot of torque
customer_reviews.text: For bike rides, this is a great size. When I got it, I thought it would be too small to work on my bike's axle nuts, but it fits them, and I was able to loosen them. Not a bad little tool, jaws are square and tight without binding, nice finish. I have nicer tools, but I also have worse ones. I would say this of similar quality as Home Depot or Sears Craftsman tools. I've heard of people sawing the handle short on bigger wrenches in order to save weight, but having a nice tiny wrench like this kind of makes that unnecessary. I trust this more than my "dogbone" wrench, which is lighter, but "bendy."
customer_reviews.author: M. Frobisher

customer_reviews.title: Its a wrench
customer_reviews.text: This is a wrench. It is made of good steel and seems to work well. It is not a really solid tool meaning it has very little heft. As an extra I think its great but as a primary wrench Im not sure it would hold up to rough use.
customer_reviews.author: MichaelRTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Works as Intended
customer_reviews.text: I needed a larger wrench for a home improvement project. It arrived just in time and earlier than the original projection. I'm glad to have this in my toolkit.
customer_reviews.author: Empathy

customer_reviews.title: Okay for the money, but.....
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my wife who needed a wrench this size. She was happy to receive it, but I noticed that the fit of the jaws was not as tight as the one I own made by another manufacturer. It does the job for what she's using it for though so all is well, but I deduct one star for this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy. Poorly made and practically useless. Look at my video at how flimsy it is and how much it adjusts once it’s supposed to be locked in place
customer_reviews.author: Chris G

customer_reviews.title: Love this wrench!  TEKTON 23001 4-Inch Adjustable Wrench
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE A USB tv stick for my windows 7 multi media box. and it gets HOT but i clamped this on as a heat sink. and now it's much cooler. who knew that this would be worth 10x it's cost for an unexpected purpose. that aside it works great as a wrench too.. nice quality.. tighten it down it stays tight.
customer_reviews.author: stumpedI

customer_reviews.title: Tekton 12" Wrench
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it much yet but it looks pretty solid. The gear to adjust the jaw works well. Tool weight is right for the size. This model looks a lot better than the Kobalt wrench at Lowes.
customer_reviews.author: AMZ Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: The adjustment wheel is loosey goosey. With that I don't have high hopes for much longevity with this. Suggest buying something a little more main stream.
customer_reviews.author: D.R. Whitson

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: My favorite wrench. It is big, heavy, and reliable. It arrived scratched up, not sure if demo unit, or what, but that is fine, aesthetics don't affect what I can do with it. I purchased this to remove a nova chuck adapter that had become stuck in my lathe.
customer_reviews.author: ClaytonTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time and money. I was not impressed with the quality despite glowing reviews on a tool forum. The fit and finish on these wrenches is not good. Harbor Freight wrenches are better!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: Super super small. Doesn’t really lock on a size once you adjust it so you have to keep holding it in place. Good for little things, not for a big project where you’d have to use it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Have to have one of these, right?
customer_reviews.text: This is another basic tool I bought for my grandson's beginning tool collection. Have to have it! This one is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Yimji Wills

customer_reviews.title: That gap
customer_reviews.text: It's not the most accurate but still better than what I'm currently using. For the price and my level of use, it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: David L

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints about the Quality of the product.The Quality is great,and I received it in a timely fashion,right when I needed it.I definitely would recommend,this product to anyone.I am almost pretty sure any other tools coming from this seller would be a good buy as far as Quality,Pricing ,and Fast Delivery.The tool was very easy to use and very sturdy.I would say that for the price it was well worth it and then some!
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Nice little wrench
customer_reviews.text: Perfect wrench for a small motorcycle toolset. I've had good luck with Tekton's tools and this is no exception so far. The action on the adjustment gear is pretty exact and it locks pretty snug. For the price, it cannot be beat.
customer_reviews.author: James UTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Nice Crescent Wrench
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice Crescent wrench that is obviously here for the long term. I need this XL Crescent to access a table saw blade bolt and it does the job nicely. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Raleigh man

customer_reviews.title: Wrench has sizes on the side, no more guessing!? Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little wrench! It has a good heft to it and doesn't feel cheap. No more guessing if I've got it opened enough, as they've included size measurments on the tool itself! The only con is the adjustable clamp wobbles a little bit, but that in no way has impeded its usefulness!
customer_reviews.author: AllyCat

customer_reviews.title: low quality
customer_reviews.text: it would stick when trying to adjust it, the coating was chipped, I just gave it away to a coworker
customer_reviews.author: Doyle E. Hedden

customer_reviews.title: Good, Inexpensive Wrench
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend has no tools at her house, and I use most of mine so often at home that I need to keep them here, including a family of various sized adjustable wrenches. So I'm on a program of outfitting a complete tool box to leave at her house on a budget. This is a nicely made, inexpensive little adjustable wrench. It is on the small side (which I knew when I bought it). If I had it to do over again I would get an 8 or 10 inch, as I only have the one in this auxiliary tool box.
customer_reviews.author: Rev Rider

customer_reviews.title: Drop in quality
customer_reviews.text: Moving parts are loose.....not the quality I'm used to from Tekton......no more Tekton tools.....I have quite a few good ones, but no more after these.....
customer_reviews.author: Fredrick Metcalf

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, well made wrench. Happy with the purchase even though it ended up being a little small for the task I needed it for.
customer_reviews.author: jansvendsen60

customer_reviews.title: Was in pieces.
customer_reviews.text: Was in pieces when received and I was out of town so I didn’t get in returned within 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: great little fitzall wentch
customer_reviews.text: good quality - not precision machined, but I've never seen an adjustable wrench that was. Works fine, no sloppy forging, plating looks good. Probably last 200 years if not abused or left out in the yard! My brother used to do that to my dad's tools. Of course, we both got blamed. :-S
customer_reviews.author: Keith Kropf

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool.
customer_reviews.text: Thie tool is 4 in long and it is easy to adjust. It is smooth when opening and closing. I have used it in my small projects. I have not had any issues. I plan to purchase another set to utilize as a keychain as it is very portable and functional.
customer_reviews.author: Ermilo

customer_reviews.title: A BIG crescent wrench
customer_reviews.text: It's big and so far has been good. I purchased for one specific task so I've only used it a little. Having one on hand is essential for DIYers, imo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tekton Wrench
customer_reviews.text: Basic adjustable wrench. It’s not a name brand, but it will do what I need it too.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R

customer_reviews.title: Its a wrench how bad could it be?
customer_reviews.text: Its a wrench for goodness sake how bad could it be we got it to put in our bike bag.
customer_reviews.author: k t

customer_reviews.title: Child's Wrench
customer_reviews.text: You only get what you pay for. There is a lot of slop in the adjusting mechanism. I have bought other Tekton tools which were of very good quality. This one is not. Would not recommend it. Will be giving it to my grandson next time i see him for a tool.
customer_reviews.author: Ken S

customer_reviews.title: Good price and looks good but does not perform
customer_reviews.text: Wrench looked well made when I received it. However when I used it for the first time, I found that if you have a stubborn nut to turn, the jaws aren't stable enough to keep the wrench from slipping (and in my case, smashing my thumbnail). Would only recommend this wrench for light duty work.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Afterthought
customer_reviews.text: I bought this an after thought, just an extra for around inside. Turns out, it was key in resolving a nagging issue. Good job!
customer_reviews.author: M. Powell

customer_reviews.title: They work well!
customer_reviews.text: The 4 inch is tiny! Exactly what I was looking for. Nice pocket sized crescent I can carry in my pocket at work. The adjustment is smooth and overall I love it. I’ve ordered 5
customer_reviews.author: T Foland

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: Seems like it will work fine but there is a lot of slop in the gear which is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I have had good success with Tekton which is why I keep coming back to them.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good Inexpensive tool.
customer_reviews.text: Lost my last one so since I use it rarely bought 2 for less than the price of one at Home Depot. Now I have two to loose before buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Goodnight

customer_reviews.title: For the price worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Good product but the adjuster is a little loose so when the wrench is shut all the way some times it locks a little and it's hard to open. Also it will rattle loose. I carry this with my leatherman and it's very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan hawaii tested

customer_reviews.title: Really nice!
customer_reviews.text: Works beautifully. The measurements etched onto it are very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Solid wrench. Helped me to fix my leaking shutoff valve, it was so much easier than using a plier
customer_reviews.author: singjipie

customer_reviews.title: Item looks used
customer_reviews.text: From the scratches and oil stain on the wrench and the dirty plastic bag it came with, it looks like someone used it for quite some time. very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice to want to have in your box
customer_reviews.text: Are use this adjustable wrench and very tight spaces works perfect
customer_reviews.author: Israel Martinez

customer_reviews.title: does the job but sometimes comes loose
customer_reviews.text: This will do the job, but it gets 3 stars from me because even if you tighten it, sometimes in the course of using it, it comes loose again. If it weren't for that, it would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: Great little pocket wrenches. Me and both my boys have them. I use mine quite often.
customer_reviews.author: Servant of the Most High.

customer_reviews.title: 4” long handle, not 4” of wrench
customer_reviews.text: This was really my fault for not checking the description thoroughly but just to be clear: this is a 4” handle; NOT a 4” wrench. When I opened the package and saw how tiny it was, I just laughed.
customer_reviews.author: "singinghappycoconuts"

customer_reviews.title: Great Wrench
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy, and feels like your typical wrench. That's exactly what I wanted, so it's perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Impchucker

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality adjustable wrench
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small wrench to carry on my bike. I have old Craftsmen (US made) and Harbor Freight (China made) adjustable wrenches, and I would rate the Tekton between the two. It good enough for occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Handy pocket tool
customer_reviews.text: Needed small portable wrench to keep with me for those times when a wrench is required, but going to tool box is inconvenient. This little wrench is really portable (fits in top pocket of workshirt) and is capable of handling 1/2" nuts & bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Ragin' Cajun 74'

customer_reviews.title: Just don't
customer_reviews.text: It was made worse that Harbor Freight. I sent it back
customer_reviews.author: J. STERLING

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Useful Tool
customer_reviews.text: Great little tool to have around the house. I use it to adjust table feet, work in tight areas, add and remove Dremel accessories, adjust settings on larger tools. There's a lot of uses for this little guy. Very happy with my purchase. :) This should be in every tool box.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Worry free
customer_reviews.text: Good tool for the money and perfect for the workplace.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Frank

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: It gets loose easily so you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Dobrin'a

customer_reviews.title: WRONG SIZE
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 12" adjustable wrench to do some work on my truck at the barracks, when I opened the package there was a 4" adjustable wrench with a 12" label zip tied to the end. I will be returning, as I obviously needed to run up to the parts store and buy an actual size that worked to complete the task in my free time over the weekend.
customer_reviews.author: Steve DeBaca II

customer_reviews.title: Nothing it’s a plain wrench!
customer_reviews.text: I used it to tighten a bolt. It worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: S. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little companion
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for, perfect for making shadow puppets. Adjustable mouth for different voices. Long neck for giraffe character. The metal is completely opaque, that’s how you know it’s high quality. The key to creating a good shadow.. very nice. Also, can be used as some sort of adjustable wrench, so win win.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Solid and durable - a wonderful addition to my tool box for home repairs.
customer_reviews.author: Lord Humongous

customer_reviews.title: its okay
customer_reviews.text: it does okay but does not stay in place once you have adjusted the levels
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Adjuatable!
customer_reviews.text: I use it almost daily and by far one of the best adjustables I've had. Love the quality, the feel, and the fact it doesn't drift when using it. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stadtler

customer_reviews.title: Another Cheap Wrench
customer_reviews.text: It's just like the cheap ones we've been seeing for 50 years. The adjusting nut has skinny threads that engage the jaw loosely, and the nut moves around and won't keep its adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: TedC

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Nice, a little thin on the handle but definitely a quality tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good little wrench
customer_reviews.text: This wrench is handy and I use it on my vehicle
customer_reviews.author: Brennan

customer_reviews.title: They're durable and cheap.
customer_reviews.text: I needed two of these to tighten the bolts/washers on my TDS power squat rack. They have a lifetime warranty. That's all!
customer_reviews.author: grand-poobah

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I kept losing more expensive ones at work so I decided to get this one. It's better than I expected, fairly sturdy, loosens easily though.
customer_reviews.author: Ty H.

customer_reviews.title: Small, but mighty!
customer_reviews.text: This little wrench is the perfect size to fit in your front shirt pocket! I bought it for my husband to use at work because he was tired of having to run to the tool box to grab a wrench whenever he needed to adjust something. He loves this wrench. It's not too heavy so it doesn't bother him when it's in his pocket and it's not too small, a man with large hands can use it easily. It's seriously one of the most useful tools he has!
customer_reviews.author: MelindaW

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Came exactly as described and all of it is of great quality
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: the product functions, it is just made of cheap quality, and might not last.
customer_reviews.author: U shah

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I love this. I gave one to my dad. Beats digging out the socket set when you just need to fix a loose nut.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Theriault

customer_reviews.title: Not too big, not too small.  JUST RIGHT.
customer_reviews.text: Just the think I needed for a toolkit of small portable tools for working on laptops and desktops. Not too big, not too small. JUST RIGHT.
customer_reviews.author: Earnest T.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly small, yet surprisingly useful
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it much, but seems like a great little wrench. Excellent for tight spaces. I bought it for a small tool kit for my bag to compliment the Leatherman Surge I carry daily. For its intended purpose, I don't think this little guy could be beat.
customer_reviews.author: ktackett

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made, they are just painted silver and the paint wore off on one side from being in my tool bag. I will be returning when my craftsman come in
customer_reviews.author: Jerrad

customer_reviews.title: Cheap at half the price
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made. Jaw has considerable slop/play, so won't hold the setting. I'd return it but too much trouble for a $6 item. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: HI Baker

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's expected to.
customer_reviews.text: Li'l devil. Small to hold but so damn powerful. I repaired my bicycle with this. It would be good if the handle is made larger.
customer_reviews.author: Soumyananda Goswami

customer_reviews.title: Missed a spot...
customer_reviews.text: As a small, inexpensive adjustable wrench, it's fine -- nothing great, nothing terrible. It did get marked down for finishing. Both the moving and fixed jaws had significant burrs on every edge of their faces. Easy but annoying to file off; shouldn't have had to.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Carter

customer_reviews.title: You want this!
customer_reviews.text: Solid, well made, will last years and a bargain. Look no further.
customer_reviews.author: George Georgalis

customer_reviews.title: This is a horrible tool. Invest more money
customer_reviews.text: This is a horrible tool. Invest more money, buy an original BAHCO and skip this one. The jaws are getting loose after each (!) turn, making it so uncomfortable to work with that I always leave it and take a correct size spanner. Fit and finish maybe ok, but re-tightening those jaws again and again is making this tool useless. Cheap priced will be more expensive...
customer_reviews.author: Michael Steinmann

customer_reviews.title: Makes a wonderful utilitarian keychain
customer_reviews.text: It does what I ask it to. A utility keychain
customer_reviews.author: JimBarn1961

product_meta.title: TEKTON 23001 4-Inch Adjustable Wrench
product_meta.description: Size:4 in.Designed for tight and hard-to-reach spaces, the TEKTON 4 in. Adjustable Wrench can take on bicycle repair and furniture assembly. It also works well to secure back nut or bolt while tightening or loosening front nut or bolt with a socket or combination wrench. TEKTON adjustable wrenches are designed to be versatile enough to tighten and loosen fasteners of various sizes without needing to grab other tools. Made from durable carbon steel with a corrosion-resistant satin chrome finish, our wrenches will become a permanent staple in your toolbox. Manufactured to strict quality specifications, TEKTON adjustable wrenches meet or exceed ANSI performance standards. Precision-machined for a tight fit, the slide jaw and worm gear contact in 3 spots for smooth operation and less play. Knurling on worm guide allows for quick jaw size adjustment. The satin finish keeps wrench looking like new by hiding scratch marks that can be seen in regular chrome finished wrenches. Jaw opening guide has permanent laser etched size markings in both metric and Inch scales. The dual Inch/metric scale is useful measuring the size of nuts and bolts. Each wrench displays a stamped length size and model number for distinction among your TEKTON adjustable wrenches.
feature_bullets: Drop forged and heat-treated carbon steel construction with a corrosion-resistant satin chrome plated finish
Precision-machined slide jaw and worm gear allows for exact fastener fit and smooth adjustment
Quick fit jaw opening guide with permanent laser-etched size markings in 1/16 in. And 1mm increments

specifications.Special Features: Precision-machined slide jaw and worm gear allows for exact fastener fit and smooth adjustment
